Description: Chalcedony (?) integral finger-ring, bezel is carved to resemble a scarab, with clypeus, elytra and striated legs marked, the shoulders are elaborated with incised floral motifs.
Curator's comments: On chalcedony use in ancient Egypt (includes agate, onyx, carnelian and sardonyx), see Aston et al, 'Stone' in P.T. Nicholson and I. Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000): 25-8.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1891 / Illahun, Kahun and Gurob (p. 17, pl. XVII)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
